title: By the Queene. The Queenes most excellent Maiestie consyderyng that the great [and] horrible conspiracies, treasons, and rebellions lately practised, attempted, and with open action prosecuted in the north partes of her hyghnesses realme by the earles of Northumberlande and westmerlande ...
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
publisher: In Powles Churchyarde by Richarde Iugge and Iohn Cawood, Printers to the Queenes Maiestie,
notes: A proclamation pardoning certain rebels in the North.
Last complete line of text ends: "inheritaunce".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
